properties.areaDesc: Daviess, IN; Knox, IN; Greene, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 8:42AM EST until January 19 at 2:17AM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

Driftwood River...Eagle Creek...East Fork White River...Eel River...
Sugar Creek...Tippecanoe River...Wabash River...White River...
Wildcat Creek...


.With rainfall totals between 1 to 1 and a half inches there are
widespread flooding concerns across much of Indiana. Over the next
couple of days we will see another 1 to 3 inches of rain or more
possible.

The Flood Warning continues for
The White River at Newberry.
* from Sunday morning to Sunday January 19.
* At  7:30 AM Friday the stage was 6.3 feet.
* Flood stage is 13.0 feet.
* Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by Sunday morning and continue to
rise to near 19.0 feet by late Monday night.  It will fall below
flood stage by Saturday January 18.
* At 19.0 feet...Extensive agricultural flooding is in progress.  Some
state and county roads flood.  County Road 600 W just north of
river flooded by possibly more than two feet of water for a
considerable distance in Mary Long Cutoff Area.  County Roads 900 W
and 750 S begin to flood in Greene County.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
